intro: Melissitus afghanicus, commonly known as the Afghan honeybee plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Afghanistan. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful to animals and humans if ingested. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky slopes or in dry forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
